New Records: Malik Monk scored 31 points in the Sacramento Kings 138-133 win over the Grizzlies
Key Match Events: The Kings went on a 20-10 run to regain the lead capped with a 3-pointer by Monk with 4:21 remaining
The Grizzlies took a 110-109 lead on Scottie Pippen Jr.'s two free throws at the 7:56 mark of the fourth quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams combined for 150 points in the first half
The Kings made 29 of 59 shots from the field (52.7%) while the Grizzlies knocked down 26 of 50 shots (52%)
The teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter
The Kings were 10 of 18 while the Grizzlies made 7 of 11
Others: Devin Carter made his debut with the team in the first quarter
Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion
Ja Morant (right AC joint strain) and Marcus Smart (right index finger) did not play
Keegan Murray missed his second straight game for the Kings (left ankle soreness)
